abstract.text: A multipage interface that displays one page at a time.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: A tab view contains a row of tabs that give the appearance of folder tabs, as shown in the
. The user selects the desired page by clicking the appropriate tab or using the arrow keys to move between pages. Each page displays a view hierarchy provided by your app.

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your macOS app.
A role-based protocol that declares the minimum interface necessary to interact with an assistive app.
The complete list of properties and methods for accessible elements.
A set of methods that defines a way to add animation to an existing class with a minimum of API impact.
A set of methods for getting and setting the appearance attributes of a view.
A set of methods that the destination object (or recipient) of a dragged image must implement.
Methods that responder subclasses implement to support key binding commands, such as inserting tabs and newlines, or moving the insertion point.
A multipage interface that displays one page at a time.
These constants specify the tab view’s type as used by the
property.
Adds the specified tab item.
A Boolean value that indicates if the tab view allows truncating for labels that don’t fit on a tab.
The rectangle describing the content area of the tab view.
The size of the tab view.
The tab view’s control tint.
The tab view’s delegate.
A Boolean value that indicates if the tab view draws a background color when its type is
The font used for the tab view’s label text.
Returns the index of the specified item in the tab view.
Returns the index of the item that matches the specified identifier or
if the item is not found.
Inserts the specified item into the tab view’s array of tab view items at the specified index.
The minimum size necessary for the tab view to display tabs in a useful way.
The number of items in the tab view’s array of tab view items.
Removes the specified item from the tab view’s array of tab view items.
This action method selects the first tab view item.
This action method selects the last tab view item.
This action method selects the next tab view item in the sequence.
This action method selects the previous tab view item in the sequence.
Selects the specified tab view item.

The tab view item for the currently selected tab.
Returns the tab view item at
in the tab view’s array of items.
Returns the tab view item at the specified point.
The tab view’s array of tab view items.
The tab type to display the tabs.
Sets the selected tab view item to the selected item obtained from the sender.
A container view controller that manages a tab view interface, which organizes multiple pages of content but displays only one page at a time.
The
protocol defines the optional methods implemented by delegates of
objects.
An item in a tab view.
A protocol that an object adopts to create a bar object in your app.
A protocol that marks classes to restore the state of your app to continue a user activity.
A set of methods used to associate a unique identifier with objects in your user interface.
The infrastructure for drawing, printing, and handling events in an app.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
